p: The chemical analysis conducted using GC-MS characterized the VOs with seven components classified into oxygenated ingredients mainly ketones and nonoxygenated ingredients mainly hydrocarbons in all three samples with different proportions ( Table 1). The most abundant components in all three samples were pulegone and isomenthone. The total identified components in the three samples were almost consistent in which 90.48, 94.44, and 93.55% of the constituents were identified in Nablus, Ramallah, and Hebron districts, respectively. Detailed results are represented in Table 1. Other five common compounds identified in all three samples with total percentage less than 2% were D-Limonene, β-Pinene, Isocaryophyllene, α-Pinene, and β-Myrcene ( Table 1).
